block.p: On Paper and More National Design Center of the American Institute of Graphic Arts, 164 Fifth Avenue (22nd Street); (212) 807-1990.

''Art is Work: Milton Glaser Retrospective,'' an exhibition of posters, logos, record albums, magazines, newspapers, drawings, textiles, toys, furniture and books designed by Mr. Glaser in the past 25 years, starts Wednesday and runs through Dec. 27. Mr. Glaser, primarily a graphic designer, is known for the ''I Love NY'' logo, and for the graphic identity for the Rainbow Room restaurant in 1987. Open Monday through Friday, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. No charge.
On Paper and More National Design Center of the American Institute of Graphic Arts, 164 Fifth Avenue (22nd Street); (212) 807-1990.

''Art is Work: Milton Glaser Retrospective,'' an exhibition of posters, logos, record albums, magazines, newspapers, drawings, textiles, toys, furniture and books designed by Mr. Glaser in the past 25 years, starts Wednesday and runs through Dec. 27. Mr. Glaser, primarily a graphic designer, is known for the ''I Love NY'' logo, and for the graphic identity for the Rainbow Room restaurant in 1987. Open Monday through Friday, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. No charge.
Designs From the 60's Cooper-Hewitt National Design Museum, 2 East 91st Street; (212) 849-8400.

A discussion about design in the 1960's will take place tonight at 6:30, with Jack Lenor Larsen, a textile designer; Seymour Chwast, a graphic designer and Lesley Jackson, the author of ''The Sixties: Decade of Design Revolution'' (Phaidon, 1999). Fee, $25; students, $20.
Open Doors 41 Union Square West at 17th Street; (212) 255-8315.

Thirty-five painters, sculptors, photographers and jewelry designers will take part in an open house at their studios at 41 Union Square West, on Saturday and Sunday, from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. No charge.
Haitian Artworks Skylight Room of the Puck Building, 295 Lafayette Street (Houston Street); (212) 529-7861.
A show and sale of furniture and decorative objects by artisans from Haiti will take place today, from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m., and tomorrow, from 9 a.m. to 9 p.m. Free admission.
All Greek Merchant's House Museum, 29 East Fourth Street; (212) 777-1089.

''Minard Lafever and His Circle: the Diffusion of Grecian Architecture in the United States, 1830-1860,'' an exhibition of models, photographs and books about the Greek Revival period, will be at the museum today through Dec. 11.

A two-day symposium featuring talks and tours on Greek architectural styles in the United States will take place in several locations, on Saturday, from 9 a.m. to 5:45 p.m., and on Sunday, from 10:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Reservations are required: (917) 237-1208. Fee, both days, $165; Saturday only, $100; Sunday only, $85.
